title: Garamond-esqe Typeface
content: I'm looking for a font that has the elegance/classical of Stempe Garamond but feels contemporary. I'm using it with Interstate. Thanks
author: LoremIpsumLoremIpsum

comments.content: Right now i have Bembo but its too "book" like. Something a little crisper but a full family of weights. Thanks!!!
Ok. I updated my list. Let me know what you think.

Fantastic.

Cicero seems perfect. Although it may be so perfect that i have to rework my design. :)

Verdigris, Delicato are nice too.
[[http://www.linotype.com/1436/sabon-family.html|Sabon]] and [Sabon Next](http://web.archive.org/web/20100820040034/http:/www.linotype.com/53159/sabonnext-family.html) should be added to the list.

If you like Puyfoulhoux's Cicéro, you might also like [ITC Mendoza](http://web.archive.org/web/20100820040034/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/itc_mendoza_roman_std/) which was designed by Puyfoulhoux's mentor, José Mendoza.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/376079506/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100820040034/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/376079506/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/376079506/")

Sabon Next has a nice feel to it.

Stephen Coles, is that Trade Gothic in your avitar? The characters seem to have similar quality but are a bit more open.
Cicero has that "Stone Informal" kind of feel to it. A little too soft for my tastes. Love that ITC Mendoza though.
